elements.name: When a GET request is sent to the /api/getBloodGroup endpoint with valid authorization information,
elements.description:
it should be verified that the status code returned is 200 and the message information in the response
                    body is “Success” and  the information (name, is_blood_group, created_at) returned in the response body
                    of id(x) should be verified..

steps.name: The api user sets "api/getNotice" path parameters.

steps.name: The api user sends a GET request and saves the returned response.
The api user verifies that the status code is 200.
The api user verifies that the "message" information in the response body is "Success".
The api user verifies the information in the response body for the entry with the specified 0 , including "notice", "noticehospital","null","notice hospital","2024-12-06".

name: As an administrator (admin) I should be able to access the list of blood types registered in the system via API connection.

elements.name: Invalid Token When a GET request is sent to the /api/visitorsPurposeList endpoint with invalid authorization
elements.description:
information, it should be verified that the status code returned is 403 and the message in the response body is
  "You do not have authorization or token error.".

steps.name: The api user sets "api/visitorsPurposeList" path parameters.
The api user sends a GET request, saves the returned response, and verifies that the status code is '403' with the reason phrase Forbidden.

name: As an administrator (admin) I should be able to access the Visitor Purpose List via API connection.
